comments:
Build M9.

I regret that I do not have precise steps for recreating this error -- all I 
have is the attached error log.  I saw the entry added to the Error Log when I 
opened a features editor.  Maybe related to the asyncExec call in the trace 
(add a widget.isDisposed() check)?

Normally I wouldn't bother reporting such a trivial problem, but 3.0 GA isn't 
that far away.  I have noticed that my error log regularly fills with "benign" 
(?) messages throughout the day.

I haven't been able to reproduce this thus far. :(

Inputs into MultiSourceEditor are not null and the error seems to fall into
MultiPageEditorPart in platform ui.  I'd like to reassign this one to Platform
UI for an isDisposed() check if possible 

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2689)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2614)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2585)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:381)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:283)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkParent(Widget.java:223)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.<init>(Widget.java:111)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.<init>(Control.java:88)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable.<init>(Scrollable.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.<init>(Composite.java:86)
	at org.eclipse.ui.part.MultiPageEditorPart.addPage(MultiPageEditorPart.java:118)
	at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormEditor.addPage(FormEditor.java:160)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.MultiSourceEditor.addSourcePage(MultiSourceEditor.java:29)

MultiPageEditorPart reasonably assumes that it has not been disposed when
addPage is called.  FormEditor (or other subclass) needs to ensure that it is
not trying to add a page when the editor has been disposed.

This could also be put in the asyncExec runnable, or in InputContextManager.

The check needs to be done at a higher level than MultiPageEditorPart since
there may be other work getting done.  If MultiPageEditorPart just ignored the
addPage request, you would be left in an inconsistent state.

This is not Eclipse Forms - this is caused by MultiSourceEditor adding pages 
without checking if the widget is disposed. Similar to MultiPageEditorPart, 
the assumption that pages are not added when the control is disposed also 
holds for FormEditor.
ancient history.  the editor has been rewritten since this bug was first reported.
